Premise: If the sun shines tomorrow, then we will go to the beach.
If it rains tomorrow, then we will go to the museum.
Either we will not go to the beach or we will not go to the museum.
Hypothesis: Therefore either it will not be sunny or it will not be rainy.
Label: True

Premise: If I have 1 million dollars, I will donate half of it.
If I have 10 million dollars, I will donate 75% of it.
Either I will not donate 500 thousand dollars or 7.5 million dollars.
Hypothesis: Therefore I will not have 1 million or 10 million dollars.
Label: True

Premise: If I am working out, I am happy.
If I am sleeping, I am dreaming.
Either I am not happy or I am not sleeping.
Hypothesis: Therefore I am working out or I am sleeping.
Label: False

Premise: If it rains, roads will be muddy
If it snows, roads will be slippery
Either the roads will not be muddy or the roads will not be slippery.
Hypothesis: Therefore, it will be rainy or it will be snowy.
Label: False

Premise: If you take Logic, you will have to do a lot of homework
If you take Philosophy, you will have to write a lot of papers.
Since you didn't do a lot of homework or you didn't have to write a lot of papers.
Hypothesis: Therefore, you didn't take logic and you didn't take Philosophy.
Label: Undetermined
